name: js/Statistics/Statistics.js
Statistics
description:
A class for the Statistics object. Has functions for incrementing
and decrementing expected and actual pomo sessions,
total time and work time spent, and storing distractions.
Also handles local storage elements for stats.

name: constructor
description:
Constructor of Statistics object. Initializes all variables to zero,
overwrites them from memory if available, updates DOM.

name: addHTMLChildren
description: Adds all child HTML elements to the statistics popup

name: parentDiv
description: The div to which the page is appended

name: tasksCompletedP
description: Number of tasks completed

name: tasksCompletedPLabel
description: Label for number of tasks completed

name: timeSpent
description: Total time spent

name: timeSpentLabel
description: Label for total time spent

name: timeWorking
description: Total time spent working

name: timeWorkingLabel
description: Label for total time spent working

name: timePerTask
description: Average time per task

name: timePerTaskLabel
description: Label for avg time per task

name: brokenSessions
description: Total number of unique broken sessions

name: brokenSessionsLabel
description: Label for total number of unique broken sessions

name: expectedPomoSessionsData
description: Total projected number of pomo sessions

name: expectedPomoSessionsLabel
description: Label for projected number of pomo sessions

name: actualPomoSessionsData
description: Total number of working pomo sessions

name: actualPomoSessionsLabel
description: Label for total number of working pomo sessions

name: avgDistractions
description: Average number of distractions per task

name: avgDistractionsLabel
description: Label for average distractions per task

name: distList
description: List of distractions

name: updateDistractionList
description: Creates a list item for each logged distraction

name: addEventListeners
description: Creates event listeners for toggling tabs within the stats popup

name: updateDom
description:
Updates the HTML elements to display values of local variables.
Called when stats button is called.

name: incrementTasksCompleted
description: Increments by one every time a task is marked as completed

name: decrementTasksCompleted
description:
Decrements by one every time a task is marked as not-completed given that
there are tasks that can be uncompleted. Updates local storage when called.

name: addDistraction
description:
Adds a distraction (represented by a JSON object) to the list of distractions.
Updates local storage when called.

params.name: distraction
params.description: Distraction to be added

name: getNumUniqueDistractions
description:
Gets the number of broken work sessions. If multiple distractions
during one work session occurred, only counts as one unique broken pomo session.

name: getAvgDistractionsPerTask
description: Counts average number of distractions per task

unknown.tagValue: {Number} Average number of distractions per task rounded to the nearest tenth

return.description: Average number of distractions per task rounded to the nearest tenth

name: addTimeSpent
description: Increments the total time spent. Updates local storage when called.

params.name: numMins
params.description: Number of minutes to increment count by

name: addWorkTime
description:
Increments the work time spent. When work time incremented, so is total time spent
(runs as separate method call to addTimeSpent())

params.name: numMins
params.description: Number of minutes to increment work count by

name: addExpectedPomoSessions
description:
Increments the planned number of pomo sessions for the work day.
Should be called each time a task is added.

params.name: numSessions
params.description: Number of sessions to increment count by

name: deleteExpectedPomoSessions
description:
Decrements the planned number of pomo sessions for the work day.
Should be called each time a task is deleted. Only decrements if new tasks
were added during the current work day.

params.name: numSessions
params.description: Number of sessions to decrement count by

name: incrementActualPomoSessions
description:
Increments the number of completed pomo sessions for the work day.
Should be called each time the timer finishes a work session.
Updates local storage when called

unknown.tagValue: {Number} Average work minutes per completed task rounded to the nearest whole minute

return.description: Average work minutes per completed task rounded to the nearest whole minute

name: loadFromLocalStorage
description: Loads all variables from local storage or sets them to zero if not found

name: updateMinorLocalStorage
description: Writes all class variables to local storage

name: flushHistory
description:
Deletes all history records that are older than one year. To be used with
 year-to-date information. Updates local storage only for history record when called.

name: dataToCompressExists
description:
Sees if the last time that a day was started was earlier than 3 a.m. today.
If the work day was started at 3 a.m. or later, do not clear data,
treat everything as a single work day.
Otherwise, would compress data into history and clear variables.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} False if session started on or after 3 a.m. today. Else True.

return.description: False if session started on or after 3 a.m. today. Else True.

name: compressStats
description:
Compresses necessary local variables to a history record and
pushes the record to local storage.
Should run when the End Day button is hit or when page loads and
dataToCompressExists() true. Dispatches reset-timer event to reset timer PomoSessionId to 0.

name: clearData
description: Resets all variables back to zeroed/empty values

Adds task to the end of the todolist depending on if it is checked or not.
If checked, adds to the end. If not checked, adds right before the first
checked task (i.e. makes the task being added the last unchecked task)

params.description: task object that needs to be added

TodoListDom

Done so their is a clear abstraction from DOM Manipulation and Data Manipulation

params.description: Form to add the task

params.name: deleteAllBtn
params.description: Delete all tasks button

description: The button where users click to submit their todo's

name: deleteAllBtn
description: The button where users click to delete their todo's

name: finishTaskBtn
description: The button where users click to check off the current task

description: The table where the todolist is displayed

name: currentTask
description: The current task the user should be working on

name: currentTaskDiv
description: The current task to be displayed

name: renderLocalStorage
description:
Fetch local storage, and store them into window.localData
Iterate each local tasks and render them

name: setupEventListeners
description:
Sets up the form dissapearing and submit event listeners
Also set up finish task button

name: displayTask
description: Adds a task to the bottom of the table OR adds it before the specified index

params.name: newTask
params.description: task you want added

params.name: index
params.description: index you want to insert the task before

name: onSessionComplete
description: This function runs when the timer is done with its working session

name: onCompletedTask
description:
This function runs when someone checks off a task. Removes the task from the
table and appends it to the bottom. Removes the task from the todolist
data structure and appends it to the bottom there

name: getFirstCompletedTaskIndex
description:
This function returns the index of the first completed task,
used when new tasks/ unchecked tasks are added.

name: onUncheckedTask
description:
Called when someone unchecks a task. Removes the task from the table
and appends it become the last unchecked task in the table. Does the same
within the todolist data structure

params.name: id
params.description: id of the task you would like to uncheck

name: updateCurrentTask
description: Updates the current task and changes its checkbox property accordingly

name: onFocusTask
description:
Function that puts the task with the given id to the top
of the table

params.name: id
params.description: id of task to focus on

name: js/ToDoList/TodoListDomVariables.js
HTMLAttributes
description: The object that stores the textContent for each HTML elements.

name: TaskStorage
description:
The object that stores the corresponding index of each element.
Used in the array of JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('tasks'))

content:
# PomoXV
[![CD](https://github.com/nickkro25/cse112_team15/actions/workflows/CD.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/nickkro25/cse112_team15/actions/workflows/CD.yml)

PomoXV is a web application dedicated to making the Pomodoro Technique as easy as possible. 

[Check out the application here!]( https://nickkro25.github.io/cse112_team15/)

## App Instructions

Read about how to use PomoXV in the ["App Walkthrough"](https://github.com/nickkro25/cse112_team15/wiki/App-Walkthrough) section of our wiki.

## Setup 
Requires:
- NodeJS + NPM

First, clone and cd into the repo
```bash
$ git clone <url>
$ cd cse112_team15
```
Install all the dependencies
```bash
$ npm install
```
Start the webapp on a local server
```bash
$ npm start
```
To view the app, open the localhost url in Chrome.

## Next Steps

### Code Documentation
To view the code documentation for the app,
```bash
$ git checkout dev_docs
go to /dev-docs/index.html
right click the file and host as a live server
```

### Logistical Documentation
To view the logistical documentation for the app (meeting notes, ADRS, etc), visit [here]( https://github.com/nickkro25/cse112_team15_docs)

### Contributing to the project
To get started contributing, visit the ["How to Contribute"]( https://github.com/nickkro25/cse112_team15/wiki/How-to-Contribute) section in the wiki!

## Future Roadmap
Here are some features we would have liked to add but couldn't due to time constraints:
- Improved statistics to let the user track their habits better
- Account system to let the user keep their stats and tasks across different devices
- Better accessibility, especially for colorblind people and people who need to use assistive technology such as screen readers
- More friendly and attractive mobile UI
- Restructured HTML and CSS for accessibility, SEO, and better developer experience
- Analytics / contact point to get user feedback

And some issues that still need to be fixed up:
- Ugly color theme transition upon refresh
- UI is inconsistent (highlighting, colors, modals such as the delete all modal)
- Need more robust testing (especially for notifications)
- Documentation is lacking for newly added code
- No CSS/HTML validator in the pipeline yet, need to manually validate
- Nav header switches colors slower
